CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lillie Smith, 628 Lowell Street was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 29, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do people, whom you know, place more emphasis on social life than civic responsibilities?" answer reads: "I think that about 25 per cent of the people think more about civic affairs."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lillie Smith wearing flecked button down coat with collar, standing in front of window with neon sign inscribed "Waldo..", brick wall with advertising for Pepsi-Cola in background
